name: Turn YouTube Comments into Content Ideas with GPT-4.1-mini, Tavily & Apify

user.name: Muhammad Bello
user.bio:
I‚Äôm Muhammad,
 
I focus on solving real business problems, not just systems, because a lot of them struggle with Repetitive manual tasks, Delayed responses, and Onboarding taking too long. My aim is to help them save time and make money.

description:
## Description

This n8n template demonstrates how to turn raw YouTube comments into **research-backed content ideas** complete with **hooks and outlines**.

Use cases include:

* Quickly mining a competitor‚Äôs audience for video ideas.  
* Generating hooks and outlines for your own channel‚Äôs comments.  
* Validating content opportunities with live audience feedback.  

**Good to know**

* Apify is used to scrape YouTube comments (requires an API token).  
* GPT-4.1-mini is used for both filtering and content generation.  
* Tavily provides fresh research to ground the AI‚Äôs responses.  
* All outputs are stored in Google Sheets, making it easy to manage and track ideas.  

---

## How it works

1. **Trigger** ‚Äì Paste a YouTube URL into the chat trigger.  
2. **Scrape Comments** ‚Äì Apify fetches all comments and metadata.  
3. **Filter** ‚Äì GPT-4.1-mini decides if each comment could inspire a content idea.  
4. **Store** ‚Äì Comments and ‚ÄúYes/No‚Äù decisions are appended to Google Sheets.  
5. **Research & Enrich** ‚Äì For ‚ÄúYes‚Äù comments, Tavily provides context, and GPT generates a topic, hook, and outline.  
6. **Update Sheet** ‚Äì The same row in Google Sheets is updated with enriched fields.  

---

## Google Sheets Setup  

Your Google Sheet should include these columns (in this order):  


id | text | author | likes | isIdea | topic | research | hook | outline
- **id** ‚Äì unique identifier for each comment  
- **text** ‚Äì the full YouTube comment  
- **author** ‚Äì commenter‚Äôs name/handle  
- **likes** ‚Äì number of likes on the comment  
- **isIdea** ‚Äì ‚ÄúYes‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo‚Äù depending on GPT filter  
- **topic** ‚Äì extracted video topic  
- **research** ‚Äì 300‚Äì500 word background from Tavily  
- **hook** ‚Äì engaging opening sentence for a video  
- **outline** ‚Äì structured video outline  

---

## Setup Steps

* Connect your **Apify**, **OpenAI**, **Tavily**, and **Google Sheets** credentials in n8n.  
* Point the Google Sheets nodes to your own document and ensure the above headers exist.  
* Replace sample API keys with your own stored in n8n Credentials.  

**Time to set up:** \~15‚Äì25 minutes for a first-time n8n user (less if you already have credentials handy).  

---

## Customizing this workflow  

* **Filter logic** ‚Äì Loosen the GPT filter to allow borderline ideas, or tighten it to only accept the best ones.  
* **Research depth** ‚Äì Change Tavily‚Äôs search depth (e.g., `depth: basic` vs `depth: advanced`) to control how detailed the background research is.  
* **Notification channels** ‚Äì Send new ‚ÄúYes‚Äù ideas directly to **Slack** (`#content-ideas`), **Notion** (your content board), or **Email** (notify the content manager instantly).  
* **Alternative outputs** ‚Äì Instead of hooks/outlines, generate:  
  - A **script draft** for YouTube Shorts.  
  - **Blog post angles** based on the same audience comments.  
  - A **poll question** for community engagement.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

workflow.name: Turn YouTube Comments into Content Ideas using n8n & OpenAI

nodes.name: Transforming a researched YouTube video topic into a compelling video concept

values.content:
=Overview

You are an AI agent tasked with transforming a researched YouTube video topic into a compelling video concept. Your responsibilities include crafting a high-engagement hook and structuring a clear outline based on provided research.

Context

You will receive a video topic and a 300‚Äì500 word research overview generated by a previous agent.

Your role is to turn this into a viewer-grabbing hook and a logically sequenced outline for a potential YouTube video.

The channel could cover any niche (technology, business, lifestyle, education, etc.).

The target audience is people interested in the niche who want actionable insights, practical tips, or strategies.

The tone should be curiosity-driven, engaging, and structured while remaining actionable.

You are not responsible for scripting, only ideation and structuring.

Instructions

Read the topic and research_overview.

Generate a one-sentence hook designed to immediately capture interest.

The hook should raise curiosity, pose a bold question, or present a powerful benefit or surprise.

It should resonate with viewers interested in the topic or niche.

Create a clear outline (3‚Äì6 bullet points) that logically sequences the video‚Äôs content.

The outline should align with the research and the channel‚Äôs focus.

Begin with a compelling context or insight, develop through practical or strategic steps, and end with a takeaway or next step.

Output your results in JSON format with two keys: hook and outline.

Tools

None (uses only provided data)

Examples

Input:

{
  "topic": "How to Optimize Your Morning Routine for Maximum Productivity",
  "research_overview": "Research shows that starting your day with specific routines like exercise, planning, and focused work blocks can dramatically increase daily output and reduce stress..."
}


Output:

{
  "hook": "What if you could double your productivity before lunch with just a few simple morning tweaks?",
  "outline": [
    "Why most morning routines fail to boost productivity",
    "Key habits that top performers use every day",
    "Step-by-step structure for an optimized morning",
    "Tips for maintaining energy and focus throughout the day",
    "Common mistakes to avoid when creating your routine",
    "How to adjust and personalize your routine for lasting results"
  ]
}

SOP (Standard Operating Procedure)

Ingest the topic and research_overview.

Identify the most outcome-driven, intriguing, or curiosity-provoking angle.

Write a hook that grabs viewer attention within 5‚Äì10 seconds.

Break the research down into 3‚Äì6 clear, logically ordered outline points that deliver actionable or insightful value.

Output in strict JSON format with the keys: hook and outline.

Final Notes

Avoid fluff or generic intros‚Äîeach outline point should provide substance or actionable advice.

The hook should clearly communicate the value or intrigue of the video.

Maintain viewer retention by front-loading curiosity and delivering value with each section.

nodes.name: Extracting content topics from YouTube comments

values.content:
=You are a helpful research assistant.  

YouTube comment to analyze: {{ $json.text }}

=# Overview  
You are an AI agent specialized in extracting content-worthy topics from YouTube comments and conducting real-time research to support video ideation.

## Objectives:  
Begin by analyzing the YouTube comment to identify a relevant, engaging, and curiosity-driven topic. Once the topic is extracted, use the Tavily tool to perform real-time research based on that topic.

Based on your findings, return a structured JSON object that includes:
- A clear and compelling video topic derived from the comment  
- A 300‚Äì500 word research overview that:  
  - Expands on the topic with current, factual information  
  - Includes recent trends, statistics, and real-world examples (citing sources like ‚Äúaccording to [source]‚Äù)  
  - Maintains an educational, unbiased, and informative tone  
  - Highlights why the topic is timely, interesting, or useful for a broad audience  

## Output Instructions:  
- Your ONLY output should be a JSON object with the keys: `topic` and `research_overview`.  
- Do not include any setup text, notes, or formatting outside of the JSON object.  
- Ensure the research overview is between 300‚Äì500 words and tightly aligned with the topic.  

## Example Workflow:  
1) Receive a YouTube comment (e.g., ‚ÄúEveryone‚Äôs ditching Ozempic for berberine. Is that stuff legit?‚Äù)  
2) Extract the core topic implied by the comment (e.g., ‚ÄúBerberine vs Ozempic for weight loss‚Äù)  
3) Use Tavily to search for up-to-date and credible information about the topic  
4) Write a 300‚Äì500 word summary that outlines background, recent developments, and key takeaways  
5) Return the result in this exact format:  
```json
{
  "topic": "Berberine vs Ozempic: Why This Natural Supplement is Gaining Popularity in Weight Loss Conversations",
  "research_overview": "Berberine, a compound found in several plants, has recently gained traction as a potential natural alternative to Ozempic, a GLP-1 receptor agonist. As of 2025, TikTok and Reddit communities have seen a surge..."
}

=Overview

You are an AI agent responsible for analyzing YouTube comments and determining whether they contain a relevant idea or inspiration for new content on a YouTube channel.

Context

The channel focuses on a specific niche (business, tech, lifestyle, education, etc.).

The goal is to identify comments that could lead to tutorials, explanations, walkthroughs, tips, or deeper dives into topics relevant to the channel.

Comments may relate to questions, suggestions, feedback, or curiosity about the channel‚Äôs content or area of expertise.

Instructions

Read the YouTube comment provided via input.

Evaluate whether the comment contains one or more of the following types of content opportunities:

A direct or implied suggestion for a tutorial, guide, or walkthrough related to the niche.

A question about how to do something, solve a problem, or use a tool/service in the niche.

Feedback or confusion that highlights areas where further explanation would help the audience.

Curiosity about applying techniques, tools, or strategies within the niche.

Requests or suggestions related to topics the channel regularly covers.

Output only:

"Yes" ‚Üí if there is a viable content idea.

"No" ‚Üí if the comment does not suggest a topic that could be turned into a video.

Tools

Input: {{ $json.text }}

Examples

Input: "Can you show how to optimize Instagram posts for more engagement?"
Output: Yes

Input: "How did you start your podcast and grow it so fast? Would love that story."
Output: Yes

Input: "Still confused about setting up Google Analytics for my website."
Output: Yes

Input: "Love your energy! üî•"
Output: No

Input: "Subscribed because this is interesting!"
Output: No

Input: "Which camera is better for travel vlogs?"
Output: Yes

SOP (Standard Operating Procedure)

Parse the YouTube comment from {{ $json.text }}.

Review the content against the relevance checklist under Instructions.

Assess whether the comment aligns with the channel‚Äôs core topics and areas of expertise.

Output "Yes" or "No" based on the presence or absence of a content opportunity.

Final Notes

Emphasize relevance to the channel‚Äôs niche and audience.

Avoid tagging generic compliments or off-topic comments as relevant.

When in doubt, favor inclusion if there‚Äôs a clear path from the comment to a teachable, engaging, or high-leverage video topic.

parameters.content:
## Try It Out!
### This n8n template demonstrates how to turn **YouTube comments into researched content ideas with hooks and outlines**.  

Use cases are many: repurpose YouTube discussions into new videos, blog posts, or social media content, while keeping all your ideas stored and enriched in Google Sheets.  

### How it works
* Paste a YouTube URL into the chat trigger.  
* Apify scrapes the video‚Äôs comments.  
* OpenAI filters comments to find which ones are viable content ideas.  
* Google Sheets stores raw comments (avoiding duplicates).  
* For each ‚ÄúYes‚Äù comment, Tavily researches the topic and generates a research overview.  
* OpenAI then transforms that into a **hook + outline**.  
* The same Google Sheets row is updated with the new data.  

### How to use
* Activate the workflow.  
* Paste a YouTube URL into the chat input.  
* Watch it run: scrape ‚Üí filter ‚Üí save ‚Üí research ‚Üí generate hook/outline ‚Üí update Sheets.  

### Requirements
* n8n instance (self-hosted or Cloud)  
* Google Sheets with edit access  
* API keys:  
  * Apify (for scraping YouTube comments)  
  * OpenAI (for analysis + generation)  
  * Tavily (for web research)  

### Need Help?
Join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d) or ask in the [Forum](https://community.n8n.io/)!  

Happy Building!

## 4. Filter ‚ÄúYes‚Äù Comments
 

This node checks the AI output.  
Only comments marked **‚ÄúYes‚Äù** continue through the workflow.  
Comments marked **‚ÄúNo‚Äù** stop here.

## 8. Generate Hook & Outline (OpenAI)
 
This node transforms the researched topic into a compelling **hook** and detailed **outline**.  
The result is production-ready material for your next piece of content.

## 9. Update Google Sheets with Enriched Data
[Read more about the Google Sheets node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlesheets)

Finally, the workflow updates the same Google Sheets row with:  
* `topic`  
* `research`  
* `hook`  
* `outline`  

This way, each comment and its enriched output stay neatly in one row.

## 7. Research Topics with Tavily + OpenAI
 
For each saved comment, OpenAI works together with **Tavily** to generate:  
* A concise **topic**  
* A 300‚Äì500 word **research overview**  

This ensures your content ideas are backed by real, up-to-date information.

## 5. Save Raw Comments to Google Sheets
[Read more about the Google Sheets node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlesheets)

All valid comments are appended to your Google Sheet.  
* Prevents duplicates using `id` as the key.  
* Stores comment text, author, likes, replies, and the Yes/No flag.

## 3. Analyze Comments with OpenAI
 
This node uses **GPT-4.1-mini** to evaluate whether a YouTube comment is a viable content idea.  
It outputs only **‚ÄúYes‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo‚Äù**, keeping the logic simple and consistent.

## 2. Scrape YouTube Comments (Apify)
[Read more about the HTTP Request node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.httprequest)

This node calls **Apify‚Äôs YouTube Comments Scraper** API.  
It collects raw comment data (`id`, `text`, `author`, `likes`, `replies`, etc.) from the video and passes them to the next step.

## 1. Chat Trigger ‚Äì Paste YouTube URL
 
This node starts the workflow when you paste a YouTube video URL into the chat input.  
The URL is passed downstream as `{{ $json.chatInput }}` for scraping.

## 6. Split in Batches (Loop)
[Read more about the Split in Batches node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.splitinbatches)

This node processes comments **one by one** to ensure each gets researched and enriched individually before updating Sheets.
